page.title: 08FLORA AND FAUNA (1)
page.content: This area is under the supervision of both a Countryside Warden based on Tottington and a North West Water Authority Conservation and Recreation Project Officer, based on Belmont. The local hunt, the Holcombe, and the Pennine Foxhounds Footpack (which hunt without horses), based in Huddersfield, cover these moors where there are still foxes to be found as well as many rabbits, hares, grouse and some pheasant. Pheasants are specially bred and then released in land lower down each October and some return to the moorlands. There are two shoots: Belmont to the west and Longworth to the east of the main road. There are also small rodents such as voles, moles, shrews, hedgehogs, grey squirrels and occasional badgers and lizards; roe deer are even seen on occasions.
